entry.title: Biomaterials-4 | 生物材料-4
entry.content:
Lecture Outline | 課程大綱

  • Outline | 講義提要
    • Advantages of ceramics and metals for medical implants | 醫用植入物中陶瓷和金屬的優勢
    • Composition of Bone | 骨的組成
    • Three types of ceramics in biomaterials and their differences | 生物材料中三種陶瓷及其區別
    • Difference between biocompatibility, bioactivity and biodegradability | 生物相容性、生物活性和生物可降解性的區別
    • Hydroxyapatite and its properties and applications | 羥基磷灰石的性質與應用
    • Solid state sintering | 固態燒結
    • Basic properties of metals | 金屬的基本性質
    • Relative elastic modulus of different biomaterials | 不同生物材料的彈性模量比較
    • Criteria for orthopaedic implant and choices of materials | 骨科植入物的標準及材料選擇
    • Comparison of three types of metals as orthopaedic implant | 三種金屬作為骨科植入物的比較
    • Corrosion of metallic implants and solutions | 金屬植入物的腐蝕及解決方案

Ceramic and Metal Biomaterials: Types, Manufacturing, and Applications | 陶瓷與金屬生物材料：類型、製造與應用

Ceramic | 陶瓷

Ceramic Types & Manufacturing | 陶瓷類型與製造

  • Traditional Ceramics: Porcelain, Stoneware, Earthenware; each uses unique chemical compositions and raw materials. The Hong Kong/Canton region is known for specialized techniques.
    傳統陶瓷： 瓷器、炻器、陶器；各自採用獨特的化學成分和原材料。港粵地區以專門工藝著稱。
  • Manufacturing Process: Clay (powder + water) is shaped, dried (shrinks and reorganizes), then fired/sintered to bond particles.
    製造過程： 粘土（粉末+水）成型、乾燥（收縮與重組）、燒結使顆粒結合。
  • Materials: Kaolinite and Bentonite clays; Flint and Quartz additives reduce shrinkage; Feldspar creates glossy, non-porous finishes.
    原材料： 高嶺土和膨潤土；燧石和石英添加劑減少收縮；長石形成光滑致密表面。

Biomedical Ceramic Classifications | 生物醫學陶瓷分類

  • Bioactive Ceramics: Bond with tissue (e.g., glass ceramics for implant coatings, stimulate hydroxyapatite formation).
    生物活性陶瓷： 能與組織結合（如用於植入物塗層的玻璃陶瓷，促進羥基磷灰石形成）。
  • Bioresorbable Ceramics: Biodegradable (e.g., calcium phosphate compounds, hydroxyapatite).
    生物可吸收陶瓷： 可降解（如磷酸鈣化合物、羥基磷灰石）。
  • Bioinert Ceramics: Minimal tissue interaction (e.g., pyrolytic carbon, alumina for joint replacements and dental crowns).
    生物惰性陶瓷： 與組織相互作用極少（如用於關節置換和牙冠的熱解碳、氧化鋁）。

Natural Ceramics in the Body | 體內天然陶瓷

  • Bone: ~60% minerals (mainly hydroxyapatite), ~26% collagen, plus cells. Cortical (dense) and trabecular (porous) types; bone marrow contains stem and immune cells.
    骨骼： 約60%礦物質（主要為羥基磷灰石）、約26%膠原蛋白及細胞。分為緻密骨和鬆質骨；骨髓含有幹細胞和免疫細胞。
  • Teeth: Higher inorganic content; layers include enamel, dentin, and pulp. Strength from nanostructured calcium phosphate.
    牙齒： 無機物含量更高；分為琺瑯質、牙本質和牙髓。強度來自奈米結構磷酸鈣。

Sintering Process & Applications | 燒結工藝與應用

  • Sintering: Occurs at ~⅓ melting point; surface atoms bond without full melting.
    燒結： 在約熔點三分之一溫度下進行，表面原子結合但未完全熔化。
  • Applications: Thermal spray coatings, porous structures for cell migration, dental crowns (zirconia vs. alumina), hip implants with hydroxyapatite coatings.
    應用： 熱噴塗塗層、細胞遷移的多孔結構、牙冠（氧化鋯與氧化鋁）、帶羥基磷灰石塗層的髖關節植入物。

Overview of Biomedical Materials | 生物醫學材料概述

  • Ceramics: Biocompatible, mainly for implant coatings.
    陶瓷： 生物相容性好，主要用於植入物塗層。
  • Metals: High mechanical strength, used for load-bearing implants.
    金屬： 機械強度高，用於承重植入物。

Ceramic Manufacturing & Applications | 陶瓷製造與應用

  • Steps: Raw material prep, shaping, drying, sintering.
    步驟： 原料準備、成型、乾燥、燒結。
  • Applications: Dental/orthopedic coatings, surface treatments to minimize protein/cell deposition and reduce friction.
    應用： 牙科/骨科塗層，表面處理減少蛋白質/細胞沉積和摩擦。

Metals | 金屬

Types & Properties of Medical Metals | 醫用金屬類型與性質

  • Stainless Steel: Affordable, but poor corrosion resistance.
    不銹鋼： 價格低廉，但耐腐蝕性差。
  • Cobalt-Based Alloys: Better corrosion resistance, but potential carcinogenic ion release.
    鈷基合金： 耐腐蝕性更好，但可能釋放致癌離子。
  • Titanium Alloys: Best biocompatibility and corrosion resistance, non-toxic, but expensive.
    鈦合金： 生物相容性和耐腐蝕性最佳，無毒但價格昂貴。

Special Metal Materials | 特殊金屬材料

  • Shape Memory Alloys: Nickel-Titanium; used in braces, stents, IVC filters; return to shape when heated.
    形狀記憶合金： 鎳鈦合金；用於牙套、支架、下腔靜脈濾器，加熱後可恢復原形。
  • Liquid Metals: Solid at room temp, liquid at body temp; used in wearable electronics (e.g., mercury, gallium).
    液態金屬： 常溫為固體，體溫為液體；用於可穿戴電子（如汞、鎵）。
  • Biodegradable Metals: Magnesium- and zinc-based; gradually absorbed by the body.
    可降解金屬： 鎂基和鋅基金屬，能被人體逐漸吸收。

Corrosion Issues & Protection | 腐蝕問題與防護

  • Mechanism: Oxidation, electrode formation, accelerated by moisture/oxygen.
    機制： 氧化、電極形成，受潮濕/氧氣加速。
  • Biological Impact: Corrosion products trigger immune response and inflammation, may cause bone degradation.
    生物影響： 腐蝕產物引發免疫反應和炎症，可能導致骨質破壞。
  • Protection: Use corrosion-resistant metals (chromium, titanium), inert ceramic coatings, and protective oxide layers.
    防護措施： 採用耐腐蝕金屬（鉻、鈦）、惰性陶瓷塗層和保護性氧化層。

Tutorial | 教程

Practice Questions | 練習題

Q1. What is the driving force for the sintering (firing) process of ceramics? | 陶瓷燒結過程的驅動力是什麼？

  • A. The high surface free energy under heat and pressure | 高溫高壓下的高表面自由能
  • B. High pressure in the environment | 環境中的高壓力
  • C. Heat (causing the melting of ceramics particles) | 熱（導致陶瓷顆粒熔化）
  • D. Ironic attraction | 離子吸引

✅ A. The high surface free energy under heat and pressure
Explanation: Sintering occurs due to the reduction of surface energy, promoting particle bonding under heat.
解析： 燒結是由於表面能降低，在加熱下促進顆粒結合。

Q2. What is the difference between bioactive and bioinert ceramics in dental implants? | 牙科植入物中生物活性陶瓷與生物惰性陶瓷的區別是什麼？

  • A. Coating of implant; coating for crown | 植入物塗層；牙冠塗層
  • B. Implant; coating for crown | 植入物；牙冠塗層
  • C. Coating of implant; Implant | 植入物塗層；植入物
  • D. Implant; Crown | 植入物；牙冠

✅ C. Coating of implant; Implant
Explanation: Bioactive ceramics are used as coatings to promote bone bonding; bioinert ceramics are used as structural implant materials.
解析： 生物活性陶瓷用於塗層促進骨結合，生物惰性陶瓷用於結構性植入材料。

Q3. What is the chemistry behind the corrosion resistance of titanium dioxide? | 二氧化鈦耐腐蝕性的化學原理是什麼？

  • A. Titanium dioxide is very chemically stable and does not react with most of the chemicals | 二氧化鈦化學性質非常穩定，不與大多數化學物質反應
  • B. It is metal oxide | 它是金屬氧化物
  • C. It is white | 它是白色的
  • D. None of the above | 以上都不是

✅ A. Titanium dioxide is very chemically stable and does not react with most of the chemicals
Explanation: TiO₂ forms a passive, stable oxide layer that protects titanium from corrosion.
解析： 二氧化鈦形成穩定的鈍化氧化層，保護鈦免受腐蝕。

Q4. Why is stainless steel still used despite titanium’s superiority? | 儘管鈦更優，為什麼仍使用不銹鋼？

  • A. Cost | 成本
  • B. Accessibility | 易獲得性
  • C. Tradition and habit | 傳統與習慣
  • D. All of the above | 以上全部

✅ D. All of the above
Explanation: Stainless steel is cheaper, widely available, and historically used in implants.
解析： 不銹鋼價格低廉、易獲得且有歷史使用傳統。

Q5. Roles of polymer, ceramic, and metal in full hip replacement | 全髖關節置換中聚合物、陶瓷和金屬的作用

  • A. Acetabulum: Polymer; Femoral head: Ceramic; Femoral stem: Metal | 髖臼：聚合物；股骨頭：陶瓷；股骨柄：金屬
  • B. Acetabulum: Ceramic; Femoral head: Metal; Femoral stem: Polymer | 髖臼：陶瓷；股骨頭：金屬；股骨柄：聚合物
  • C. Acetabulum: Metal; Femoral head: Polymer; Femoral stem: Ceramic | 髖臼：金屬；股骨頭：聚合物；股骨柄：陶瓷
  • D. Acetabulum: Ceramic; Femoral head: Ceramic; Femoral stem: Metal | 髖臼：陶瓷；股骨頭：陶瓷；股骨柄：金屬

✅ D. Acetabulum: Ceramic; Femoral head: Ceramic; Femoral stem: Metal
Explanation: Polymer is used in acetabular liners, ceramic for femoral heads, and metal for femoral stems.
解析： 聚合物用於髖臼襯墊，陶瓷用於股骨頭，金屬用於股骨柄。

Q6. Dental Implant Design | 牙科植入物設計

  • (4 marks) List two major reasons people choose titanium to make the dental implant (screw). | 列舉兩大選擇鈦製作牙科植入物（螺釘）的理由
  • (6 marks) List two benefits of the hydroxyapatite coating. | 列舉羥基磷灰石塗層的兩大優點

Titanium advantages:

  • Excellent biocompatibility | 優異的生物相容性
  • High corrosion resistance due to stable oxide layer | 穩定氧化層帶來高耐腐蝕性

Hydroxyapatite coating benefits:

  • Promotes osseointegration (bone bonding) | 促進骨結合
  • Mimics natural bone mineral, enhancing biological response | 模仿天然骨礦物，增強生物反應

Q7. What is pyrolytic carbon? | 什麼是熱解碳？

✅ Pyrolytic carbon is a ceramic-like material known for its biocompatibility, chemical inertness, and wear resistance.
Explanation: It is produced by the thermal decomposition of hydrocarbons and is widely used in heart valve prostheses and orthopedic implants due to its durability and compatibility with blood and tissue.
解析： 熱解碳是一種類陶瓷材料，具有生物相容性、化學惰性和耐磨性。由碳氫化合物熱分解製得，廣泛用於心臟瓣膜和骨科植入物，因其耐用且與血液和組織相容。

Q8. What kind of material is the Simon IVC filter made of? | Simon下腔靜脈濾器由什麼材料製成？

✅ The Simon IVC filter is made of a shape memory metal, typically nitinol (nickel-titanium alloy).
Explanation: Nitinol provides flexibility, biocompatibility, and self-expanding properties, making it ideal for vascular implants like IVC filters.
解析： Simon下腔靜脈濾器由形狀記憶金屬製成，通常為鎳鈦合金。鎳鈦合金具有柔韌性、生物相容性和自擴展性，適合血管植入物。

entry.title: Biomaterials-5 | 生物材料-5
entry.content:
🧭 Lecture Outline | 課程大綱

  • Introduction | 引言
  • Nanomaterials | 奈米材料
    • Gold Nanoparticles (AuNPs) | 金奈米粒子
    • Quantum Dots (QDs) | 量子點
    • Liposomes & Lipid Nanoparticles (LNPs) | 脂質體與脂質奈米粒子
  • Fabrication Techniques | 製造技術
    • Synthesis Methods | 合成方法
    • Surface Engineering | 表面工程
  • Biomedical Applications | 生物醫學應用
    • Principles of Nanomedicine | 奈米醫學原理
    • Gene Therapy & Delivery | 基因療法與傳遞

🧠 Nanomaterials: Origins & Impact | 奈米材料：起源與影響

Historical Foundations | 歷史基礎

  • The concept of nanotechnology was popularized by Richard Feynman in his 1959 lecture “There’s Plenty of Room at the Bottom” | 奈米技術的概念由理查德·費曼在1959年的演講“底部有足夠的空間”中推廣。
  • Feynman used vivid storytelling to advocate for atomic-scale engineering, inspiring decades of research | 費曼以生動的敘事方式提倡原子尺度工程，激發了數十年的研究。
  • Many of his predictions have since been realized through modern nanotechnology | 他的許多預測已通過現代奈米技術實現。

Evolution of Medical Applications | 醫療應用的演變

  • Initial breakthroughs (1980s–1990s): | 初期突破（1980年代至1990年代）：
    • PEGylation for drug stability | PEG化增強藥物穩定性
    • Targeting ribosomes | 靶向核糖體
    • Endometriosis treatments | 子宮內膜異位症治療
  • Current technologies: | 當前技術：
    • Lipid and ceramic nanoparticles | 脂質與陶瓷奈米粒子
    • Polymer micelles and protein carriers | 聚合物膠束與蛋白質載體
    • Cell-based and viral delivery systems | 基於細胞與病毒的傳遞系統

🔬 Key Properties of Nanomaterials | 奈米材料的關鍵特性

Surface-to-Volume Ratio | 表面積與體積比

  • As particle size decreases, the proportion of surface atoms increases: | 隨著粒徑減小，表面原子的比例增加：
    • ~90% for single-atom layers | 單原子層約90%
    • ~35% for 7-layer clusters | 7層簇約35%
    • <5% for 30 nm particles | 30奈米粒子小於5%
  • This enhances chemical reactivity and biological interaction | 這增強了化學反應性和生物交互作用。

Size-Dependent Behavior | 尺寸依賴行為

  • Nanomaterials exhibit unique properties not seen in bulk materials | 奈米材料展現出與大塊材料不同的獨特特性。
  • Operate in a transitional zone between molecular and macroscopic scales | 在分子與宏觀尺度之間的過渡區運作。
  • Enable novel applications in medicine, electronics, and energy | 實現醫學、電子與能源的新應用。

🟡 Gold Nanoparticles & Localized Surface Plasmon Resonance (LSPR) | 金奈米粒子與局部表面電漿共振

Discovery & Physical Properties | 發現與物理特性

  • First observed by Michael Faraday in 1857: wine-colored gold colloids | 1857年由邁克爾·法拉第首次觀察：酒紅色金膠體。
  • Gold nanoparticles have a lower melting point than bulk gold | 金奈米粒子的熔點低於大塊金。
  • Exhibit Localized Surface Plasmon Resonance (LSPR): | 展現局部表面電漿共振（LSPR）：
    • Oscillation of conduction electrons in response to light | 傳導電子響應光的振盪
    • Responsible for vivid colors (e.g., red from 520 nm green light absorption) | 負責鮮艷的顏色（例如，520奈米綠光吸收產生紅色）

Applications | 應用

  • Biosensors: | 生物感測器： Fluorescence quenching for detection | 螢光淬滅用於檢測
  • mRNA detection: | mRNA檢測： Using detachable linkers | 使用可分離連接物
  • Protein biomarkers: | 蛋白質生物標誌物： Enhanced sensitivity via plasmonic effects | 通過電漿效應增強靈敏度

Tuning LSPR | 調節LSPR

  • Size Increase | 尺寸增加 → Red shift in absorption | 吸收紅移
  • Shape Control | 形狀控制 (e.g., nanorods) → Longitudinal resonance in far-red region | （例如奈米棒）→遠紅區的縱向共振
  • Aggregation | 聚集 → Red shift due to interparticle coupling | 因粒子間耦合導致紅移

🌈 Quantum Dots (QDs): Color by Size | 量子點：尺寸決定顏色

Overview | 概述

  • Semiconductor nanocrystals with size-dependent emission | 具有尺寸依賴發射的半導體奈米晶體
  • Recognized by the 2022 Nobel Prize | 2022年諾貝爾獎認可

Mechanism | 機制

  • Smaller QDs → Larger band gap → Emission at shorter wavelengths (blue) | 較小的量子點→較大的能隙→較短波長發射（藍色）
  • Larger QDs → Smaller band gap → Emission at longer wavelengths (red) | 較大的量子點→較小的能隙→較長波長發射（紅色）

Manufacturing | 製造

  • Synthesized at ~300°C using cadmium, selenium, and sulfur | 在約300°C下使用鎘、硒和硫合成
  • Stabilized with ZnS shells and organic ligands | 使用ZnS殼和有機配體穩定

Advantages | 優勢

  • Photostability: Resistant to photobleaching | 光穩定性：抗光漂白
  • Broad absorption with narrow emission | 寬吸收與窄發射
  • Used in QLED displays, solar cells, and bioimaging | 用於QLED顯示器、太陽能電池和生物成像

🌐 SPR vs LSPR Technologies | SPR與LSPR技術比較

Feature特性SPR (Surface Plasmon Resonance)表面電漿共振LSPR (Localized SPR)局部表面電漿共振
Evanescent Field折射場250 nm – 1 μm250奈米 - 1微米Much shorter更短
Propagation Length傳播長度Microns to millimeters微米到毫米Localized局部
Resonance Conditions共振條件Prism optics稜鏡光學Light wavelength光波長
  • SPR: | 表面電漿共振： Surface wave at metal-dielectric interface | 金屬-介電界面上的表面波
  • LSPR: | 局部表面電漿共振： Electron cloud oscillation around nanoparticles | 奈米粒子周圍的電子雲振盪
  • LSPR explains the color of gold nanoparticles | LSPR解釋了金奈米粒子的顏色

🧪 Liposomes & Lipid Nanoparticles (LNPs) | 脂質體與脂質奈米粒子

Liposomes | 脂質體

  • Discovered by Alec Bangham in the 1960s | 1960年代由Alec Bangham發現
  • Composed of a double lipid bilayer enclosing an aqueous core | 由雙層脂質膜包圍水性核心組成
  • Can encapsulate both hydrophilic and hydrophobic drugs | 可包封親水性和疏水性藥物
  • Common components: phospholipids, PEG-lipids, cholesterol | 常見成分：磷脂、PEG-脂質、膽固醇
  • Fabrication: freeze-drying → hydration → size control | 製造：冷凍乾燥→水合→尺寸控制

Lipid Nanoparticles (LNPs) | 脂質奈米粒子

  • Solid lipid-based particles for nucleic acid delivery | 用於核酸傳遞的固體脂質粒子
  • Fabricated via microfluidics | 通過微流控技術製造
  • Typical formulation: 12 mg/mL lipids, 25% ethanol | 典型配方：12毫克/毫升脂質，25%乙醇
  • Purification: tangential flow filtration (TFF), dialysis, size exclusion | 純化：切向流過濾（TFF）、透析、尺寸排阻

🧭 Nanomaterial Fabrication Strategies | 奈米材料製造策略

Bottom-Up Approaches | 自下而上方法

  • Chemical synthesis: e.g., gold nanoparticles via citrate reduction | 化學合成：例如，通過檸檬酸還原製備金奈米粒子
  • Self-assembly: lipid vesicles, micelles | 自組裝：脂質囊泡、膠束
  • Spray drying: for drug particle formation | 噴霧乾燥：用於藥物粒子形成

Top-Down Approaches | 自上而下方法

  • PRINT® technology: Particle Replication in Non-wetting Templates | PRINT®技術：非潤濕模板中的粒子複製
  • Photolithography: Inspired by microelectronics | 光刻技術：受微電子啟發
  • Graphene exfoliation: Electrochemical peeling | 石墨烯剝離：電化學剝離

Surface Stabilization | 表面穩定

  • Charge-based (e.g., citrate): unstable in salt solutions | 基於電荷（例如檸檬酸）：在鹽溶液中不穩定
  • Steric-based (e.g., PEG): preferred for stability and protein corona prevention | 基於空間位阻（例如PEG）：穩定性和防止蛋白冠層的首選

💊 Nanomedicine: Benefits & Challenges | 奈米醫學：益處與挑戰

Benefits of Nanoparticle-Based Drug Delivery | 基於奈米粒子的藥物傳遞益處

  • Improved bioavailability and solubility | 改善生物利用度和溶解度
  • Suitable for intravenous (IV) administration | 適合靜脈（IV）給藥
  • Extended circulation time in the body | 延長體內循環時間
  • Enhanced tissue penetration | 增強組織滲透
  • Targeted accumulation at disease sites | 靶向疾病部位積累

Design Considerations | 設計考量

  • Size: | 尺寸：
    • 150 nm → accumulation in liver, lungs, spleen | 150奈米→在肝臟、肺部、脾臟積累
    • <10 nm → rapid clearance via kidneys | 小於10奈米→經腎臟快速清除
  • Shape: | 形狀：
    • Disc-shaped particles → liver/lung/spleen targeting | 盤狀粒子→靶向肝臟/肺部/脾臟
  • Surface Charge: | 表面電荷：
    • Positive charge → increased uptake in liver/lung | 正電荷→肝臟/肺部攝取增加

Delivery Challenges | 傳遞挑戰

  • Macrophage uptake reduces circulation time | 巨噬細胞攝取減少循環時間
  • Non-specific organ distribution | 非特異性器官分佈
  • Laminar blood flow limits vascular wall interaction | 層流限制血管壁交互
  • Tumor pressure hinders deep tissue penetration | 腫瘤壓力阻礙深層組織滲透

PRINT® Technology Applications | PRINT®技術應用

  • Used by Liquidia for lung-targeted delivery | Liquidia用於肺部靶向傳遞
  • Particle size (1–5 μm) affects deposition depth | 粒子尺寸（1-5微米）影響沉積深度
  • Particle shape influences biodistribution | 粒子形狀影響生物分佈

⚡ Charge-Stabilized Nanoparticles | 電荷穩定奈米粒子

  • Less stable than PEG-coated particles | 比PEG塗層粒子穩定性低
  • Stabilization via electric double layer: | 通過電雙層穩定：
    • Stern layer: tightly bound ions | 斯特恩層：緊密結合的離子
    • Diffusive layer: loosely bound ions | 擴散層：鬆散結合的離子
  • Salt exposure disrupts the double layer → aggregation | 鹽暴露破壞電雙層→聚集

🧬 Gene Delivery Using Nanoparticles | 使用奈米粒子進行基因傳遞

Central Dogma of Molecular Biology | 分子生物學中心法則

  • DNA → mRNA → Protein | DNA → mRNA → 蛋白質

Types of Therapeutic Nucleic Acids | 治療性核酸類型

  • DNA: | DNA： e.g., Luxturna (FDA-approved in 2017) | 例如Luxturna（2017年FDA批准）
  • mRNA: | mRNA： e.g., Pfizer/Moderna COVID-19 vaccines | 例如輝瑞/莫德納COVID-19疫苗
  • siRNA: | siRNA： e.g., Patisiran (FDA-approved in 2018) | 例如Patisiran（2018年FDA批准）
  • microRNA: | 微RNA： experimental, not FDA-approved | 實驗性，未經FDA批准

Delivery Methods | 傳遞方法

  • Viral Vectors: | 病毒載體：
    • Retrovirus, Adenovirus, AAV, HSV | 逆轉錄病毒、腺病毒、AAV、HSV
  • Non-Viral Methods: | 非病毒方法：
    • Gene gun, Electroporation, Nanoparticles | 基因槍、電穿孔、奈米粒子

Role of Lipid Nanoparticles (LNPs) | 脂質奈米粒子（LNPs）的角色

  • Protect nucleic acids from nucleases | 保護核酸免受核酸酶降解
  • Avoid renal clearance | 避免腎臟清除
  • Facilitate endocytosis | 促進內吞作用
  • Proposed structures: onion-like, cake-like, solid core | 提出的結構：洋蔥狀、蛋糕狀、固體核心

🧫 COVID-19 Vaccine Mechanism & Industry Trends | COVID-19疫苗機制與行業趨勢

1. Mechanism of mRNA-LNP Vaccines | mRNA-LNP疫苗機制

  • mRNA encodes spike protein | mRNA編碼刺突蛋白
  • Delivered via LNPs | 通過LNPs傳遞
  • Uptaken by antigen-presenting cells (APCs) | 由抗原呈遞細胞（APCs）攝取
  • Activates B cells and T cells for immune response | 激活B細胞和T細胞以產生免疫反應

2. Market Trends (2023) | 市場趨勢（2023年）

  • 80% of vaccines use non-lipid nanoparticles | 80%的疫苗使用非脂質奈米粒子
  • Viral vectors still dominate gene delivery | 病毒載體仍主導基因傳遞

Tutorial-5 | 教程-5

Q1. Which is correct in terms of surface plasmon resonance (SPR)? | 關於表面電漿共振（SPR），哪個是正確的？

A. SPR involves valence band electrons | SPR涉及價帶電子
B. SPR involves conduction band electrons | SPR涉及傳導帶電子
C. SPR involves magnetic field oscillation | SPR涉及磁場振盪
D. None of the above | 以上皆非

✅ B. SPR involves conduction band electrons | SPR涉及傳導帶電子
Explanation: SPR is caused by the collective oscillation of conduction electrons in resonance with the electric field of incident light | 解釋：SPR由傳導電子的集體振盪引起，與入射光的電場共振。

Q2. What is the difference between LSPR and SPR? | LSPR與SPR的區別是什麼？

A. Substrate | 基板
B. Plasmon | 電漿
C. Signal | 信號
D. All | 全部

✅ D. All | 全部

Explanation: SPR occurs on flat metal surfaces; LSPR occurs on nanoparticles. Differences include substrate type, plasmon behavior, and signal detection | 解釋：SPR發生在平坦金屬表面；LSPR發生在奈米粒子上。差異包括基板類型、電漿行為和信號檢測。

Q3. Compare the longest SPR wavelength among gold nanostructures: | 比較金奈米結構中最長的SPR波長：

  1. 10 nm AuNPs | 10奈米金奈米粒子
  2. 50 nm AuNPs | 50奈米金奈米粒子
  3. 10×60 nm nanorods | 10×60奈米奈米棒
  4. 10×40 nm nanorods | 10×40奈米奈米棒

A. 1 > 3 > 2 > 4
B. 2 > 1 > 3 > 4
C. 3 > 4 > 2 > 1
D. 4 > 3 > 2 > 1

✅ C. 3 > 4 > 2 > 1

Explanation: Nanorods with higher aspect ratios show longer SPR wavelengths. Size also contributes, but shape dominates | 解釋：高縱橫比的奈米棒顯示較長的SPR波長。尺寸也有影響，但形狀主導。

Q4. Which nanoparticles change color when 3 M NaCl is added? | 添加3M NaCl時，哪些奈米粒子會改變顏色？

A. Citrate-stabilized 20 nm AuNPs | 檸檬酸穩定的20奈米金奈米粒子
B. PEG-stabilized AuNPs | PEG穩定的金奈米粒子
C. CdSe QDs with PEG | 帶PEG的CdSe量子點
D. Lipid nanoparticles with PEG | 帶PEG的脂質奈米粒子

✅ A. Citrate-stabilized 20 nm AuNPs | 檸檬酸穩定的20奈米金奈米粒子

Explanation: Salt disrupts electrostatic stabilization in citrate-coated AuNPs, causing aggregation and color change | 解釋：鹽破壞檸檬酸塗層金奈米粒子的靜電穩定性，導致聚集和顏色變化。

Q5. Quantum dots emitting blue, green, and red light—compare retention time in size exclusion chromatography: | 發射藍光、綠光和紅光的量子點—比較尺寸排阻層析中的保留時間：

A. Blue > Green > Red
B. Green > Red > Blue
C. Red > Green > Blue
D. Red > Blue > Green

✅ A. Blue > Green > Red

Explanation: Smaller QDs (blue) elute slower due to more pore interaction. Larger QDs (red) elute faster | 解釋：較小的量子點（藍色）由於更多孔隙交互作用而洗脫較慢。較大的量子點（紅色）洗脫較快。

Q6. What method can be used to make liposomes? | 哪種方法可用於製造脂質體？

A. Electrochemical exfoliation | 電化學剝離
B. PRINT technology | PRINT技術
C. Spray drying | 噴霧乾燥
D. Self-assembly | 自組裝

✅ D. Self-assembly | 自組裝

Explanation: Liposomes form spontaneously when amphiphilic lipids self-assemble in water | 解釋：當兩親性脂質在水中自組裝時，脂質體會自發形成。

Q7. Major difference between liposomes and lipid nanoparticles? | 脂質體與脂質奈米粒子的主要區別？

A. Size | 尺寸
B. Surface functional group | 表面官能團
C. Composition and function | 組成與功能
D. Surface charge | 表面電荷

✅ C. Composition and function | 組成與功能

Explanation: Liposomes have bilayer structures; LNPs are solid or amorphous. Their composition and delivery roles differ | 解釋：脂質體具有雙層結構；脂質奈米粒子為固體或非晶態。它們的組成和傳遞角色不同。

Q8. Which factor influences nanoparticle biodistribution in vivo? | 哪些因素影響奈米粒子在體內的生物分佈？

A. Size | 尺寸
B. Surface charge | 表面電荷
C. Shape | 形狀
D. All of the above | 以上全部

✅ D. All of the above | 以上全部

Explanation: All these factors affect circulation, organ targeting, and cellular uptake | 解釋：所有這些因素都影響循環、器官靶向和細胞攝取。

Q9. Why are lipid nanoparticles needed for nucleic acid drug delivery? | 為什麼核酸藥物傳遞需要脂質奈米粒子？

A. In vivo degradation by nucleases | 體內核酸酶降解
B. Renal clearance | 腎臟清除
C. Negative charge prevents membrane crossing | 負電荷阻止膜穿越
D. All of the above | 以上全部

✅ D. All of the above | 以上全部

Explanation: LNPs protect nucleic acids, improve delivery efficiency, and prevent rapid clearance | 解釋：LNPs保護核酸，提高傳遞效率，並防止快速清除。

Q10. mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID vaccine) is injected intramuscularly. | mRNA-1273（莫德納COVID疫苗）通過肌肉注射給藥。

  • Role of mRNA: Provides genetic instructions to antigen-presenting cells (APCs) to produce the spike (S) protein antigen | mRNA的角色：為抗原呈遞細胞（APCs）提供遺傳指令以產生刺突（S）蛋白抗原。
  • Role of lipid nanoparticles (LNPs): Protect mRNA from degradation, facilitate cellular uptake, and help deliver mRNA into APCs | 脂質奈米粒子（LNPs）的角色：保護mRNA免受降解，促進細胞攝取，並幫助將mRNA傳遞到APCs。
  • Target cells: APCs such as dendritic cells and Langerhans cells translate the mRNA into spike protein, initiating the immune response | 目標細胞：樹突細胞和朗格漢斯細胞等APCs將mRNA翻譯成刺突蛋白，啟動免疫反應。

entry.title: ESP32-S3 與心跳和血氧測試
entry.content:
參考 NMKING- ESP32與MAX30102血氧感測 - by 小霸王實驗室in ESP32on Posted on2023/03/26https://www.nmking.io/index.php/2023/03/26/1071/MAX30102 血氧與心率感測器重點整理
我們可以將 MAX30102（脈搏血氧和心率感測器） 連接到相同的 I2C 匯流排。MAX30102 是 I2C 裝置（預設地址 0x57），使用紅外線和紅光 LED 測量心率（BPM）和血氧飽和度（SpO2）。這適合 DIY 健康監測項目，但請注意：這不是醫療級設備，讀數受運動、指頭放置等影響，僅供學習用。
我們將使用 SparkFun MAX3010x Sensor Library（支援 MAX30102），它包含心率計算演算法。以下是完整指南，包括接線、庫安裝和基本範例程式碼（測量心率和 SpO2）。
**所需元件：**
- ESP32-WROOM-32 開發板- MAX30102 模組（通常帶指夾或貼片）- 0.96 OLED SSD1106 推薦使用SSD1306- 杜邦線- USB 線（用於程式上傳）

ESP32-S3 入門：安裝環境與 Hello World

ESP32-S3 是 Espressif 的旗艦 MCU，支援 Wi-Fi、Bluetooth 5.0 和 AI 加速，適合 IoT 專案。這篇記錄詳細說明如何安裝開發環境，並運行簡單的 Hello World 程式（LED 閃爍）。

步驟 1: 硬體準備

  • 開發板：推薦 ESP32-S3-DevKitC-1（約 NT$300）。
  • 工具：USB 線、電腦（Windows/Mac/Linux）。
  • 連接：USB 連接到電腦，確認驅動程式（CP210x 或 CH340）已安裝。

</image-card>
(圖片來源：Espressif 官方文件)

步驟 2: 安裝 Arduino IDE

  1. 下載 Arduino IDE 2.x：Arduino 官網。
  2. 在 檔案 > 偏好設定 添加 ESP32 板子 URL：
  3. 在 工具 > 板子 > 板子管理員 搜尋 “ESP32”，安裝 Espressif 的 ESP32 套件（v2.0.3+ 支援 S3）。
  4. 選擇板子：工具 > 板子 > ESP32 Arduino > ESP32S3 Dev Module。

步驟 3: 程式碼範例 - Hello World!

簡單測試Esp32, 以下是程式碼：

步驟 4: 與MAX30102 和 SSD1106 OLED 的整合

  • 目標
    • 使用 ESP32-WROOM-32 將 MAX30102 脈搏血氧感測器和 SSD1306 OLED 顯示器（128x64，I2C 介面）連接到一起，並在 OLED 上顯示心率（BPM）和血氧飽和度（SpO2），使用 Adafruit SSD1306 函式庫的 println 方法輸出英文文字（例如 “Heart Rate: [BPM]” 和 “SpO2: [SpO2]%”）。un

程式碼解釋

1. 硬體連線

- SSD1306 OLED 和 MAX30102 共用 I2C 匯流排，連接到 ESP32 的 GPIO16 (SDA) 和 GPIO17 (SCL)。- 電源使用 3.3V。- 連線表如下：
設備引腳ESP32 引腳描述
SSD1106 OLEDVCC3.3V電源（3.3V）
GNDGND接地
SCLGPIO17I2C 時鐘線
SDAGPIO16I2C 資料線
MAX30102VIN3.3V電源（3.3V）
GNDGND接地（共用）
SCLGPIO17I2C 時鐘線（共用）
SDAGPIO16I2C 資料線（共用）
INT未連接中斷引腳（可選）
  • 注意：
    • 確保所有設備共用 GND（接地）。
    • 如果 I2C NACK 錯誤持續發生，請在 SDA (GPIO16) 和 SCL (GPIO17) 各接一個 4.7kΩ 上拉電阻到 3.3V。部分模組內建上拉電阻，但外部電阻通常能提高穩定性。
    • 使用短杜邦線以減少信號干擾。
    • MAX30102 測量時，手指需完全覆蓋感測器，避免移動或環境光干擾。

2. 程式碼結構

使用說明
OLED屏幕測試：
線路連接：

- GND => GND- 3V3 => VCC- IO16 => SDA- IO17 => SCL

源代碼修改：

  • 添加 Wire.begin(16, 17); 和 Wire.setClock(100000);
  • 移除所有蜂鳴器相關程式碼
  • 添加初始化除錯訊息
  • 確保與 Adafruit SSD1306 (2.4.6) 和 SparkFun MAX3010x 相容
  • 驗證函式庫版本：
    • Adafruit SSD1306: 2.4.6
    • Adafruit GFX: 1.10.12
    • SparkFun MAX3010x: 任意版本（包含 heartRate.h）

上傳程式碼：

  1. 在 Arduino IDE 中選擇 ESP32 Dev Module 和正確的序列埠。
  2. 上傳上述程式碼。

檢查序列監視器：

  1. 打開序列監視器（115200 波特率），確認初始化訊息（例如 “SSD1306 初始化成功”）。
  2. 觀察 BPM 和 SpO2 輸出。

測試感測器：

  1. 將手指輕放在 MAX30102 感測器上（完全覆蓋，避免移動）。
  2. 等待 5-10 秒，OLED 應顯示心跳圖示、”[BPM] BPM” 和氧氣圖示、”[SpO2]%”（若 BPM > 30）。
  3. 若無手指，OLED 顯示 “Finger Please”。

預期輸出：

  • 正常成人 BPM：60-100。
  • 正常 SpO2：95-100%。
  • 序列監視器顯示類似：Bpm: 75, SpO2: 98.5

3. 問題排查

無心率或血氧讀數：

  • 確保手指正確放置（輕壓，無環境光干擾）。
  • 調整 ledBrightness（試 50-127，例如 particleSensor.setup(50, ...)）。
  • 檢查序列監視器：IR < 7000 表示未偵測到手指。
  • 血氧可能需 30 次採樣（Num）穩定。

OLED 無顯示或亂碼：

  • 若無顯示，嘗試 I2C 地址 0x3D（修改 display.begin(SSD1306_SWITCHCAPVCC, 0x3D)）。
  • 若使用 128x32 OLED，修改 SCREEN_HEIGHT 為 32。
  • 單獨測試 OLED（使用 artifact ID: e69fa0ab-7c18-4349-a8a4-5ac22e61b0ef 的程式碼）。

血氧不準確：

  • 當前公式（SpO2 = -23.3 * (R - 0.4) + 120）為簡化版。若需更高精度，可使用 SparkFun 的 Example6_SPO2（包含 spo2_algorithm.h）。
  • 確保 ledMode = 2（紅光+紅外線）。


未來計劃

  • 圖表展示
  • 記錄數據。
  • 使用 AI 模型（如簡單神經網路）檢測心律不整 [使用 TensorFlow Lite 載入預訓練模型（例如簡單 MLP 模型）檢測異常。]

Introduction to Biosignals and Biological Systems | 生物信號與生物系統簡介

Course Overview | 課程概述

This course explores biosignals and biological systems, focusing on their roles in physiological processes, measurement, and analysis. Students will learn how biosignals facilitate communication within biological systems, how these signals are processed, and how tools like MATLAB can be used to simulate signal acquisition and conversion. The course bridges biology, engineering, and data analysis to understand physiological functions and their applications in medicine.
本課程探討生物信號與生物系統，重點在於它們在生理過程、測量和分析中的作用。學生將學習生物信號如何促進生物系統內的通信、這些信號如何被處理，以及如何使用MATLAB等工具模擬信號採集和轉換。本課程結合生物學、工程學和數據分析，以理解生理功能及其在醫學中的應用。

Learning Objectives | 學習目標

  1. Define biosignals and biological systems.
    定義生物信號和生物系統。
  2. Explain the input-output model in physiological contexts.
    解釋生理環境中的輸入-輸出模型。
  3. Differentiate between analog and digital biosignals.
    區分模擬和數位生物信號。
  4. Describe the encoding and sampling process of biosignals.
    描述生物信號的編碼和採樣過程。
  5. Apply MATLAB to simulate biosignal acquisition and conversion.
    使用MATLAB模擬生物信號的採集和轉換。

What Are Biological Systems? | 什麼是生物系統？

A biological system is a collection of physiological processes or components that interact to perform a specific function. Examples include:
生物系統是由生理過程或組件相互作用以執行特定功能的集合。示例包括：

  • Cardiovascular System: Delivers oxygenated blood to tissues.
    心血管系統：將含氧血液輸送到組織。
  • Nervous System: Transmits electrical signals for communication and control.
    神經系統：傳輸電信號以進行通信和控制。
  • Endocrine System: Uses hormones for regulation.
    內分泌系統：使用激素進行調節。
  • Immune System: Responds to pathogens with inputs (e.g., antigens) and outputs (e.g., antibodies).
    免疫系統：對病原體作出反應，輸入（例如抗原）和輸出（例如抗體）。

English Discussion Prompt: How would you classify the immune system in terms of an input-output model?
Example: Inputs (pathogens) → Processing (immune cell signaling) → Outputs (antibody production, inflammation).
繁體中文討論提示：你會如何根據輸入-輸出模型對免疫系統進行分類？
示例：輸入（病原體）→ 處理（免疫細胞信號傳導）→ 輸出（抗體產生、炎症）。

What Are Biosignals? | 什麼是生物信號？

Biosignals are measurable quantities that convey information about the behavior of biological systems. They enable communication between systems and subsystems and are encoded as variations in:
生物信號是傳達生物系統行為信息的可測量量。它們促進系統與子系統之間的通信，並以以下形式編碼：

  • Electrical Energy: Ion-based signals (e.g., Na⁺, K⁺) in ECG (heart) or EMG (muscle).
    電能：基於離子（例如Na⁺、K⁺）的信號，如心電圖（ECG，心臟）或肌電圖（EMG，肌肉）。
  • Chemical Energy: Hormone or neurotransmitter concentrations.
    化學能：激素或神經傳遞物質濃度。
  • Mechanical Energy: Blood pressure, cardiac valve sounds, or motion.
    機械能：血壓、心臟瓣膜聲音或運動。

Common Biosignals in Medicine | 醫學中常見的生物信號

  • ECG: Monitors heart electrical activity (e.g., for arrhythmias).
  • EMG: Measures muscle activity (e.g., for neuromuscular disorders).
  • Blood Pressure: Tracks cardiovascular dynamics.
  • Heart Rate: Reflects cardiac response.
  • Blood Gas Concentrations: Monitors respiratory function (e.g., CO₂, O₂).

  • Cardiac Valve Sounds: Detects valve function.

  • 心電圖（ECG）：監測心臟電活動（例如心律不整）。

  • 肌電圖（EMG）：測量肌肉活動（例如神經肌肉疾病）。
  • 血壓：追蹤心血管動態。
  • 心率：反映心臟反應。
  • 血氣濃度：監測呼吸功能（例如CO₂、O₂）。
  • 心臟瓣膜聲音：檢測瓣膜功能。

Key Concepts | 核心概念

  • Input-Output Model: Describes how biological systems process stimuli (inputs) to produce responses (outputs). Example: The immune system detects pathogens (input) and produces antibodies (output).
  • Analog vs. Digital Biosignals:
    • Analog: Continuous signals (e.g., raw ECG waveform).
    • Digital: Discrete, sampled signals for analysis (e.g., digitized ECG).
  • Encoding and Sampling:
    • Encoding: Biosignals are naturally encoded (e.g., electrical pulses in neurons).
    • Sampling: Converts analog signals to digital via sampling (regular intervals), quantization (discrete values), and encoding (binary data).

  • MATLAB Simulation: Used to model biosignal acquisition, such as sampling an ECG signal, adding noise, and converting to digital format.

  • 輸入-輸出模型：描述生物系統如何處理刺激（輸入）以產生反應（輸出）。示例：免疫系統檢測病原體（輸入）並產生抗體（輸出）。

  • 模擬與數位生物信號：
    • 模擬：連續信號（例如原始心電圖波形）。
    • 數位：離散、採樣信號用於分析（例如數位化的心電圖）。
  • 編碼與採樣：
    • 編碼：生物信號自然編碼（例如神經元中的電脈衝）。
    • 採樣：通過採樣（固定間隔）、量化（離散值）和編碼（二進制數據）將模擬信號轉換為數位。
  • MATLAB模擬：用於模擬生物信號採集，例如採樣心電圖信號、添加噪聲並轉換為數位格式。

Why This Matters | 為什麼重要

Understanding biosignals and biological systems is critical for:

  • Diagnosing and monitoring medical conditions (e.g., heart disease, neurological disorders).
  • Designing medical devices (e.g., pacemakers, wearable sensors).
  • Advancing research in physiology and biomedical engineering.
    理解生物信號和生物系統對於以下方面至關重要：
  • 診斷和監測醫療狀況（例如心臟病、神經疾病）。
  • 設計醫療設備（例如心臟起搏器、可穿戴傳感器）。
  • 推進生理學和生物醫學工程研究。

This course will equip you with the tools to analyze biosignals, interpret system behavior, and apply computational techniques to real-world physiological data.
本課程將為您提供分析生物信號、解釋系統行為以及將計算技術應用於現實世界生理數據的工具。

Next Steps | 後續步驟

Explore the input-output model and signal processing through hands-on MATLAB exercises and case studies on biosignals like ECG and EMG.
通過MATLAB實操練習和生物信號（如心電圖和肌電圖）的案例研究，探索輸入-輸出模型和信號處理。

Lecture 1: Biomedical Signals and Systems / 第一講：生物醫學信號與系統

Overview / 概述

This lecture introduces the fundamentals of biomedical signals and systems, covering types of systems (SISO and MIMO), continuous vs. discrete signals, sampling, Nyquist theorem, aliasing, and digitization/resolution concepts. Examples include temperature measurements, video frame rates, and LED flashing.
本講介紹了生物醫學信號與系統的基本知識，包括系統類型（SISO 和 MIMO）、連續信號與離散信號、取樣、Nyquist 定理、混疊以及數位化/解析度概念。範例包括溫度測量、視頻幀率和 LED 閃爍。

Systems / 系統

Systems process inputs to produce outputs.
系統處理輸入以產生輸出。

Input-Output / Stimuli-Response Model | 輸入-輸出 / 刺激-響應模型

  • Biological systems can be modeled as input-output systems where stimuli (e.g., drugs, mechanical force) produce responses (e.g., motion, reflexes).
  • 生物系統可被建模為輸入-輸出系統，其中刺激（例如藥物、機械力）產生響應（例如運動、反射）。

Single Input Single Output (SISO) / 單輸入單輸出 (SISO)

  • Example: Thermistor / 範例：熱敏電阻
    • Input: Temperature / 輸入：溫度
    • System: Thermistor / 系統：熱敏電阻
    • Output: Voltage / 輸出：電壓
          flowchart LRsubgraph SISO [SISO 單輸入單輸出]  Temperature溫度 --> Thermistor熱敏電阻 --> Voltage電壓  end

Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) / 多輸入多輸出 (MIMO)

  • Example: Human Body / 範例：人體
  • Inputs: Exercise, Sweat, Food / 輸入：運動、出汗、食物
  • Outputs: Body Weight (multiple factors influencing) / 輸出：體重（多種因素影響）
    flowchart LR  subgraph A[Input 輸入]    Exercise運動 --- Fuel燃料 --- Food食物    direction BT  end  subgraph B[System系統]    Body身體  end  subgraph C[Output 輸出]    Sweat出汗 --- Body-Weight體重    direction BT  end  A --> B   B --> C

Analog and Digital Biosignals | 模擬和數位生物信號

  • Biosignals are either continuous analog (fluctuations over time) or discrete digital (encoded sequences). Conversion to electrical signals uses biotransducers (e.g., ECG electrodes).
  • 生物信號要么是連續模擬（隨時間波動），要么是離散數位（編碼序列）。轉換為電信號使用生物轉換器（例如心電圖電極）。

Comparison | 比較

FeatureAnalog SignalDigital Signal
RepresentationContinuousDiscrete
ExamplesECG waveformSampled ECG
ProsMore detailEasier processing
ConsNoise-sensitiveRisk of aliasing

Signal Encoding | 信號編碼

  • Biosignals use continuous (analog) or discrete (digital) encoding.
  • 生物信號使用連續（模擬）或離散（數位）編碼。

Continuous Encoding | 連續編碼

  • Encodes information into continuous fluctuations, e.g., temperature to voltage (Voltage = (Temp + 10) * 0.5).
  • 將信息編碼為連續波動，例如溫度到電壓（電壓 = (溫度 + 10) * 0.5）。

Sampling | 採樣

  • Converts continuous signals to digital by sampling in time (Ts = 1/fs) and amplitude. Nyquist rate: fs ≥ 2 * highest frequency to avoid aliasing.
  • 通過時間（Ts = 1/fs）和幅度採樣將連續信號轉換為數位。Nyquist率：fs ≥ 2 * 最高頻率以避免混疊。

Example | 示例

  • 75 mmHg (0-100 mmHg to 0-5V) on 10-bit ADC gives 3.75V, digital value ≈ 768.
  • 75 mmHg（0-100 mmHg映射到0-5V）在10位ADC上給出3.75V，數字值 ≈ 768。

ECG Sampling | 心電圖採樣

  • For 120 Hz ECG, minimum fs = 240 Hz. At 250 Hz, 2500 samples in 10s. Downsampling to 125 Hz risks aliasing.
  • 對於120 Hz心電圖，最小fs = 240 Hz。在250 Hz，10秒內2500樣本。下採樣到125 Hz有混疊風險。

Lecture 2: Signal Properties - Basic Measurements | 講座2：信號屬性 - 基本測量

  • This lecture covers mean, variance, RMS, and averaging for continuous and discrete signals.
  • 本講座涵蓋連續和離散信號的均值、變異數、RMS和平均。

Continuous-Time Signals | 連續時間信號

  • Mean μ = (1/T) ∫ x(t) dt (e.g., ECG baseline correction). Variance σ² and standard deviation σ measure fluctuations. RMS = sqrt( (1/T) ∫ x(t)^2 dt ) measures power. For sinusoid, RMS = A/√2.
  • 均值 μ = (1/T) ∫ x(t) dt（例如心電圖基線修正）。變異數 σ² 和標準差 σ 測量波動。RMS = sqrt( (1/T) ∫ x(t)^2 dt ) 測量功率。對於正弦，RMS = A/√2。
    English Example: x(t) = 2 sin(100π t), RMS = 1.414.
    繁體中文示例: x(t) = 2 sin(100π t)，RMS = 1.414。
    Discrete-Time Signals | 離散時間信號
  • Mean μ = (1/N) Σ x[n]. Variance σ² and standard deviation σ measure fluctuations. RMS = sqrt( (1/N) Σ x[n]^2 ).
  • 均值 μ = (1/N) Σ x[n]。變異數 σ² 和標準差 σ 測量波動。RMS = sqrt( (1/N) Σ x[n]^2 )。
    English Example: x[n] = 1,3,5,4,2, RMS ≈ 3.317.
    繁體中文示例: x[n] = 1,3,5,4,2，RMS ≈ 3.317。

Averaging | 平均

  • Averaging reduces noise by 1/√N. Ensemble averaging aligns multiple signals for noise reduction.
  • 平均通過1/√N減少噪聲。集成平均對齊多個信號以減少噪聲。

Homework 1

In this homework set, you will work with a set of Visual Evoked Response (VER) data. The VER is an EEG signal recorded near the visual cortex following a visual stimulus, like a flash of light. The individual recordings contain a significant amount of noise, thus we will be using ensemble averaging to reduce the noise and enhance the signal response.

這份作業的目的是讓你熟悉如何處理視覺誘發反應（VER）腦電訊號，並透過集成平均（ensemble averaging）來降低噪聲、提取神經反應訊號。VER 是在視覺皮質區域記錄的 EEG 訊號，通常在視覺刺激（如閃光）後出現。由於單次試驗的訊號中含有大量噪聲，因此我們需要透過多次試驗的平均來強化真正的神經反應。

🧠 Part 1: Plot EEG signal 繪製原始 EEG 訊號

✅ Objective: Visualize one raw EEG signal to understand its noisy nature. 觀察單次試驗的腦電訊號，了解其噪聲特性。
📌 Steps:

    1. Load the VER data from ver.mat. This contains 100 simulated VERs. 從 ver.mat 檔案中載入 VER 資料。
    1. Check the size of ver. 檢查 ver 的大小（應為 100 × 500）。
    1. Plot one of the individual responses to visualize the “raw” EEG signal. 繪製第一筆試驗資料（即 ver 的第一列）。

🔍 Code Breakdown
t = 0:0.005:(size(ver,2)-1)*0.005;

  • size(ver,2) gets the number of columns in the matrix ver, which represents the number of time points per trial.
  • 0:0.005:… creates a vector starting at 0, with increments of 0.005 seconds (sampling interval).

  • The final value is (size(ver,2)-1)*0.005, which ensures the time vector matches the length of each trial.
    This time vector t is essential for plotting EEG signals against time in seconds.

  • size(ver,2) 取得 ver 矩陣的欄數，也就是每筆試驗的時間點數量。

  • 0:0.005:… 表示從 0 開始，每 0.005 秒取一個時間點（即採樣間隔）。
  • 結尾的 (size(ver,2)-1)*0.005 確保時間向量的長度與試驗資料一致。
    這樣建立的 t 向量可以用來在繪圖時將腦電訊號對應到實際時間（秒）。

📊 Part 2: Ensemble Averaging 集成平均

✅ Objective: Reduce noise by averaging multiple trials. 透過多次試驗平均來降低噪聲。
📌 Steps:

  • Use MATLAB’s mean function to average multiple trials. 使用 MATLAB 的 mean 函數來平均多條試驗訊號。
  • First, average the first 25 trials → call this avg25. 先平均前 25 條試驗 → 命名為 avg25
  • Then, average all 100 trials → call this avg100. 再平均全部 100 條試驗 → 命名為 avg100
  • Plot:
    • One raw trial
    • avg25
    • avg100 All on the same graph to compare how averaging reduces noise. 看看平均後雜訊如何減少。

🔍 Code Breakdown
avg25 = mean(ver(1:25,:), 1);

  • ver is a matrix or 2D array. 是一個矩陣或二維陣列。
  • 1:25 means you’re selecting rows 1 through 25. 表示你正在選取第 1 到第 25 列的資料。
  • **: means you’re selecting all columns in those rows. 表示你選取這些列中的所有欄位。
    So,     ver(1:25,:) gives you a 25×N matrix, where N is the number of columns in ver.
    所以     ver(1:25,:)** 會回傳一個 25×N 的矩陣，其中 N 是 ver 的欄位數（也就是每筆試驗的時間點數量）。
  • mean(…, 1) Computes the mean along the first dimension (rows), meaning it averages the data across the 25 trials for each time point. 對這 25 行資料沿著第 1 維（行）做平均，也就是對每一個時間點的 25 次試驗取平均。
  • avg25: Stores the result of the averaging, which is a 1×N vector representing the average EEG signal at each time point. 儲存平均後的結果，是一個1×N 的向量，代表每個時間點的平均 EEG 訊號。

🔍 Part III: Noise Reduction Evaluation 噪聲降低評估

✅ Objective: Quantify how much noise is reduced by averaging. 量化平均處理後的噪聲降低效果。
📌 Steps:

  • Load actual_ver from ver.mat (the noise-free signal). 從 ver.mat 中載入無噪聲的 VER 訊（actual_ver）。
  • Subtract actual_ver from: 分別從原始試驗、avg25 和 avg100 中減去 actual_ver，得到噪聲估計。
    • One raw trial
    • avg25
    • avg100 to estimate noise.
  • Compute standard deviation of each noise estimate: 計算每個噪聲估計的標準差（STD）作為噪聲強度指標。
    • std_ver, std_avg25, std_avg100

📐 Part IV: Comparison with Theoretical Prediction 與理論預測比較

✅Objective: Compare actual noise reduction with theoretical expectations. 驗證噪聲是否依照理論預測隨平均次數減少
📌Steps:

  • Use the formula:
    -\text{Expected STD} = \frac{\text{STD of raw trial}}{\sqrt{N}}- where N = 25 or 100
  • Compare expected vs actual standard deviations.- 計算預測值並與實際值比較。
  • Discuss any differences and possible reasons . 討論差異與可能原因。

    Result | 結果

  • Actual STD (Raw): 1.0405
  • Actual STD (Avg25): 0.1986 | Expected: 0.2081 | Differeces: 0.0095
  • Actual STD (Avg100): 0.1005 | Expected: 0.1040 | Differeces: 0.0035

Discussion of Discrepancies | 差異原因探討 :

Several factors could explain the slight differences between actual and expected STD values | 儘管差異不大，仍可能由以下因素造成 :

  • Non-Gaussian Noise: The theoretical model assumes random, Gaussian-distributed noise. Real EEG data often includes artifacts (e.g., muscle movement, eye blinks) that deviate from this assumption.

  • 非高斯噪音：理論假設噪音為高斯分布，但實際 EEG 資料可能包含肌肉活動、眼動等非隨機干擾。

  • Signal Variability Across Trials: If the underlying neural response varies slightly between trials, averaging won’t perfectly cancel out the variability, leading to a higher actual STD than expected.

  • 試驗間訊號變異：若神經反應在不同試驗中略有差異，平均後仍可能保留部分變異。

  • Baseline Drift or Slow Trends: Low-frequency fluctuations in the signal can persist across trials and resist averaging, subtly inflating the STD.

  • 基線漂移或慢速趨勢：低頻波動可能在多次試驗中持續存在，不易被平均消除。

  • Finite Sample Effects: The expected STD is based on ideal statistical behavior. With only 25 or 100 trials, small sample effects can cause minor deviations from theory.

  • 樣本數有限：理論值基於理想統計行為，實際試驗數量有限時可能出現微小偏差。

  • Filtering or Preprocessing: If any filtering was applied before averaging, it could alter the noise characteristics and affect STD calculations

  • 前處理影響：若在平均前進行過濾或其他處理，可能改變噪音特性，影響 STD 計算。

Homework 2

In this homework set, you will aims to build your skills in visualizing signal transformations and understanding the process of discretization, which are fundamental in analyzing and processing biomedical signals in systems like those used in medical diagnostics or monitoring.

在這組作業中，您將致力於培養可視化訊號轉換和理解離散化過程的技能，這些技能對於分析和處理醫療診斷或監測系統中的生物醫學訊號至關重要。

Code usage in Matlab

To obtain the orginal “Continous Time Signal with Straight Line” x(t)

  • x-axis represent: Time
  • y-axis represent: Amplitude

Signal Transformations | 訊號轉換: Question 1 and 2

    1. Draw 𝑥(𝑡+1).
    1. Draw 𝑥(−2𝑡+1).

Question 1
Draw Draw 𝑥(𝑡+1):

  • t+1 mean moved the signal toward left by 1 unit | 將信號向左移動 1 單位
  • Or by calculate | 或透過計算 :
    • orginal_time_data = new_time_data + 1
    • new_time_data = orginal_time_data - 1
    • [ -1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] -> [ -2, -1, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

Question 2
Draw Draw 𝑥(-2𝑡+1):

  • In −2𝑡+1 involve:
    • “2t” time scaling | 時間縮放: compression by a factor of 2. | 壓縮 2 倍。
    • “-“reversal | 反轉: due to the negative sign - infront of 2t. | 由於 2t 前面的負號 -。
    • “+1” shifting | 移位 : moved the signal. | 訊號平移。
  • By calculate | 或透過計算 :
    • orginal_time_data = 2 * new_time_data + 1
    • new_time_data = - (orginal_time_data - 1) / 2
    • [ -1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] -> [ 1, 0.5, 0.5, 0, -0.5, -1, -1.5, -2, -2.5]

Signal Sampling : Question 3, 4 & 5

    1. Discretize 𝑥(𝑡) using a sampling period of 𝑇𝑠=1.

Lecture 1: History, Definition, and Outline | 第一講：歷史、定義與大綱

Introduction | 引言

  • Title: Materials for Biomedical Engineering | 生物醫學工程材料

  • Topics Covered | 涵蓋主題:
      1. Definition of Biomaterials | 生物材料的定義

Definition of Biomaterials | 生物材料的定義

  • Definition: Biomaterials are materials suitable for making devices to replace a part or function of the body in a safe, reliable, economic, and physiologically acceptable manner. | 生物材料是用於製造安全、可靠、經濟且生理上可接受的裝置，以替代身體部分或功能的材料。
  • Historical Context: The use of biomaterials dates back a long time, but the notion of biomaterials science emerged in the 1960s. | 生物材料的使用歷史悠久，但生物材料科學的概念於1960年代興起。

The definition, though initially restricted, is continually improved and provides an overview of goals, needs, and potential applications. | 該定義雖最初有限，但持續改進，提供了目標、需求和潛在應用的概述。

Clinical Needs for Biomaterials | 生物材料的臨床需求

Stems from inability to treat many diseases, injuries, and conditions: | 源於無法治療許多疾病、傷害和狀況：

  • Replacement of other therapy parts or procedures (total hip) | 替代其他治療部件或程序（全髖關節置換）
  • Correct abnormalities (spinal cord) | 矯正異常（脊髓）
  • Improve function (pacemaker, stent) | 改善功能（心臟起搏器、支架）
  • Structural, pharmaceutical effects: sutures, drug release | 結構與藥物效應：縫合線、藥物釋放

Characteristics of Four Generations | 四個世代的特徵

Generation of Biomaterials

1st-Generation

First Generation | 第一世代:

  • Restricted to materials available in the natura-environment. | 僅限於自然環境中可用的材料。
  • Used to simply repair organs. | 用於簡單修復器官。

2nd-Generation

Second Generation | 第二世代:

  • Spans a long period, starting with improvements in human knowledge and ending in the mid-20th century. | 跨越很長一段時間，從人類知識進步開始，至20世紀中葉結束。
  • Benefited from the Industrial-Revolution. | 受益於工業革命。

3rd-Generation

Third Generation | 第三世代:

  • Began with the birth-of-polymers as promising materials. | 以聚合物的誕生作為有前景的材料開始。
  • Built on scientific advancements in materials and their transformation, as well as understanding of living systems. | 基於材料及其轉化的科學進步，以及對生命系統的理解。

now

Fourth Generation | 第四世代:

  • Currently in its early stages. | 目前處於早期階段。
  • Combines “dreams and realities” with assistance from artificial-intelligence (AI). | 結合“夢想與現實”，得到人工智能（AI）的協助。

First Generation Example | 第一世代範例

  • Etruscan Dental Bridge: Gold was one of the earliest biomaterials used in ancient civilizations. | 伊特魯里亞牙橋：黃金是古代文明中最早使用的生物材料之一。
  • Oldest Known Prosthesis: A replacement for the right big toe found in a mummy from the necropolis of Thebes (circa 3,000 years ago). | 已知最古老的假肢：約3000年前在底比斯墓地發現的木乃伊右大腳趾替換物。
  • Burn Treatment: Use of tilapia skin for burns victims. | 燒傷治療：使用羅非魚皮治療燒傷患者。

Forces that Hold Atoms Together | 將原子結合在一起的作用力

Interatomic Force | 原子間作用力 Relative Strength | 相對強度 Example | 範例
Van der Waals interactions | 范德瓦爾斯作用力 Weak | 弱 Polyethylene forces that hold the chains together to make a solid | 聚乙烯中將鏈結合形成固體的作用力
Ionic | 離子鍵 Very strong | 非常強 NaCl | 氯化鈉
Hydrogen Bonding | 氫鍵 Medium | 中等 Water ice that holds the chains together | 將水冰鏈結合的作用力
Metallic | 金屬鍵 Medium-strong | 中等至強 Gold metal with a high-melting point | 高熔點金屬金
Covalent | 共價鍵 Strong | 強 The carbon-carbon bond
Cross-links in a polyacryl hydrogel | 碳-碳鍵
聚丙烯酸水凝膠中的交聯

Van der Waals or Dispersion Forces | 范德瓦爾斯或分散力

  • By considering the electron clouds (charge density in space) of two atoms or molecules, both without permanent dipole moments. | 考慮兩個無永久偶極矩的原子或分子的電子雲（空間中的電荷密度）。
  • Electron clouds are contributory in molecular form. | 電子雲在分子形態中起作用。
  • Can shift to one side of the atom/molecule, therefore, at any moment the atoms or molecules can create a fluctuating instantaneous dipole. | 可移到原子/分子的一側，因此，任何時刻原子或分子可產生波動瞬時偶極。
  • The fluctuating instantaneous dipole in one molecule typically induces such an “instantaneous dipole” in the next molecule. | 一個分子的波動瞬時偶極通常在下一個分子中誘導出類似的“瞬時偶極”。
    • They dictate the properties of many materials (for example, some polymers such as polyethylene which has no obvious dipole). | 它們決定了許多材料的性質（例如，無明顯偶極的聚乙烯等聚合物）。
    • They explain why the lipids in cell membranes assemble into the bilayer structure. A typical van der Waals interactive force (for example, CH4 … CH4) is about 9 kJ/mol. | 它們解釋了為什麼細胞膜中的脂質組裝成雙層結構。典型的范德瓦爾斯交互力（例如，CH4 … CH4）約為9 kJ/mol。

Ionic Forces and Hydrogen Bond | 離子力與氫鍵

  • Ionic force | 離子力:
    • The + and - charges are arrayed to achieve the closest interaction of opposite charges, and the furthest separation of similar charges. | 正負電荷排列以實現相反電荷的最密切交互，並使相同電荷分離最遠。
    • Typical ionic bond strength: (for example, NaCl) are about 770 kJ/mol. | 典型的離子鍵強度：（例如，氯化鈉）約為770 kJ/mol。
  • Hydrogen bond | 氫鍵:
    • Typical hydrogen bond strengths (for example, O-H … H) are about 20 kJ/mol. | 典型的氫鍵強度（例如，O-H … H）約為20 kJ/mol。

Metallic and Covalent Bonds | 金屬鍵與共價鍵

  • Single metallic bond is rarely discussed. The total interactive strength is realized through the multiplicity of the plus-minus interactions, at 25°C, aluminum will have a heat of sublimation of 325 kJ/mol, while titanium will be about 475 kJ/mol. | 單個金屬鍵很少被討論。總交互強度通過多重正負交互實現，在25°C時，鋁的升華熱約為325 kJ/mol，而鈦約為475 kJ/mol。
  • Covalent bonds are relatively strong bonds associated with sharing of pairs of electrons between atoms. Typical covalent bond strengths (for example, C-C) are about 350 kJ/mol. | 共價鍵是原子間共享電子對的相對強鍵。典型的共價鍵強度（例如，C-C）約為350 kJ/mol。

Ionically-bonded Hydrogels/Natural Polymer | 離子鍵結水凝膠/天然聚合物

For example | 例如:

  • Base acid: guluronic acid, mannuroic acid, Alginate (polysaccharide) | 基礎酸：古洛糖酸、甘露糖酸、海藻酸（多醣）
    By adding | 通過添加:
    • Cationic polymer (e.g. chitosan fraction, polylysine) | 陽離子聚合物（例如，幾丁聚醣片段、聚賴氨酸）
    • Divalent cations: (Creating salt bridge e.g. Ca2+) | 二價陽離子：（創建鹽橋，例如Ca2+）
      Form GELS using Ions or Polymers | 使用離子或聚合物形成凝膠

Collagen, the Most Abundant Protein in Mammals | 膠原蛋白，哺乳動物中最豐富的蛋白質

  • ~30% of total protein mass | 約佔總蛋白質質量的30%
  • Deposited in the extracellular matrix | 沉積於細胞外基質
  • Since the discovery of collagen II by Miller and Matukas (1969), 26 new collagen types have been found | 自米勒和馬圖卡斯（1969）發現膠原蛋白II以來，已發現26種新膠原蛋白類型
  • The common structural feature of collagens is the presence of a triple helix that can range from most of their structure (96% for collagen I) to less than 10% (collagen XII) | 膠原蛋白的共同結構特徵是存在三螺旋結構，範圍從大部分結構（膠原蛋白I為96%）到不到10%（膠原蛋白XII）
  • Collagen α chains vary in size from 662 up to 3152 amino acids | 膠原蛋白α鏈的大小從662到3152個氨基酸不等
  • The three α chains can be either identical to form homotrimers (e.g., collagen II) or different to form heterotrimers (e.g., collagen IX) | 三條α鏈可以相同形成同三聚體（例如，膠原蛋白II）或不同形成異三聚體（例如，膠原蛋白IX）

By Cold Spring Harb Perspect Biol. 2011 Jan; 3(1): a004978

Molecular Assemblies: Collagen Hierarchical Structures | 分子組裝：膠原蛋白層次結構

  • MOLECULAR ASSEMBLIES | 分子組裝:
    • α-chains -> collagen molecules (triple helices) -> collagen fibrils -> collagen fibers | α鏈 -> 膠原蛋白分子（三螺旋） -> 膠原蛋白纖維 -> 膠原蛋白纖維束
  • Collagen fibers scale | 膠原蛋白纖維尺度:
    • Up to 10s of microns, 10-500 nm | 高達數十微米，10-500奈米
  • Amino acids in the alpha chain are proline (PRO), glycine (GLY), and hydroxyproline (HYP). | α鏈中的氨基酸為脯氨酸（PRO）、甘氨酸（GLY）和羥脯氨酸（HYP）。

Types of Collagen | 膠原蛋白類型

  • TYPE 1: Skin, Nails, and Hair | 皮膚、指甲和頭髮
    • Found in ~90% of the collagen in the body. Forms 80% of dermis of skin and is the most beneficial for skin, nails, and hair. | 佔體內約90%的膠原蛋白，形成皮膚真皮的80%，對皮膚、指甲和頭髮最有益。
  • TYPE 2: Elastic Cartilage, e.g., Ear | 彈性軟骨，例如耳朵
    • Found in elastic cartilage like the ear. This type is linked to anti-ageing properties. | 存在於耳朵等彈性軟骨中，與抗衰老特性相關。
  • TYPE 3: Intestines, Blood Vessels, Muscles | 腸道、血管、肌肉
    • Occurs in the intestines and has been linked to blood vessels and muscles. | 存在於腸道，與血管和肌肉相關。
  • TYPE 4: Base Membranes for Organs | 器官基底膜
    • Found in egg whites, this collagen forms the base also forms the base membranes for organs, including the kidney. | 存在於蛋清中，形成器官基底膜，包括腎臟。
  • TYPE 5: Cornea & Embryonic Development | 角膜與胚胎發育
    • Found in the cornea. Type 5 also helps with embryonic development. | 存在於角膜。第五類型還有助於胚胎發育。

By https://absolute-collagen.com/blogs/features-testimonials/different-types-of-collagen-which-is-best

Three Aspects in Biomaterials | 生物材料的三個方面

  • Biological materials or body | 生物材料或身體
  • Implant materials | 植入材料
  • Interaction between the two in the body | 兩者在體內的交互作用

In-stent Restenosis | 支架內再狹窄

Most Successful Invention | 最成功的發明

  • Stent story | 支架故事
  • Video: https://youtu.be/f92O0iT2Odo
  • Stent is a metal or plastic tube inserted into the lumen of an anatomic vessel or duct to keep the passageway open, and stenting is the placement of a stent. | 支架是插入解剖血管或管道內腔的金屬或塑料管，以保持通道暢通，支架植入術是支架的放置。
  • The first use of a coronary stent is typically attributed to Jacques Puel and Ulrich Sigwart when they implanted a stent into a patient in Toulouse, France, in 1986. | 冠狀動脈支架的首次使用通常歸功於雅克·普埃爾和烏爾里希·西格瓦特，他們於1986年在法國圖盧茲為患者植入支架。

Pathophysiology of Restenosis | 再狹窄的病理生理學

  • The initial consequences immediately after stent placement are de-endothelialization, crush of the plaque, and stretch of the entire artery. | 支架放置後的即時後果包括去內皮化、斑塊壓碎和整個動脈的拉伸。
  • A layer of platelets and fibrin is then deposited at the injured site. Activated platelets on the surface expressing adhesion molecules such as P-selectin attach circulating leukocytes via platelet receptors such as P-selectin glycoprotein (GP) ligand. The leukocytes begin a process of rolling along the injured surface and migrate across the platelet-fibrin layer and into the tissue driven by chemical gradients of chemokines released from SMCs and resident macrophages. | 隨後在受傷部位沉積一層血小板和纖維蛋白。表面活化的血小板表達P-選擇素等黏附分子，通過血小板受體（如P-選擇素糖蛋白配體）附著循環白細胞。白細胞開始沿受傷表面滾動，並在平滑肌細胞（SMC）和駐留巨噬細胞釋放的趨化因子的化學梯度驅動下，穿越血小板-纖維蛋白層並遷移到組織中。
  • Next is a granulation or cellular proliferation phase. Growth factors are subsequently released from platelets and leukocytes, which stimulate migration of smooth muscle cells (SMCs) from the media into the neointima. The resultant neointima consists of SMCs, extracellular matrix, and macrophages recruited over several weeks. | 接下來是肉芽組織或細胞增殖階段。血小板和白細胞隨後釋放生長因子，刺激平滑肌細胞（SMC）從中膜遷移到新生內膜。最終新生內膜由平滑肌細胞、細胞外基質和數週內招募的巨噬細胞組成。
  • Over longer time periods, the artery enters a phase of remodeling involving extracellular matrix (ECM) protein degradation and resynthesis. Accompanying this phase is a shift to fewer cellular elements and greater production of ECM. | 在更長的時間內，動脈進入涉及細胞外基質（ECM）蛋白降解和再合成的重塑階段。此階段伴隨著細胞成分減少和ECM生成增加。

By Circulation. 2005; 111:237-273

Additional Info | 額外資訊

History of Coronary Stents | 冠狀動脈支架歷史

  • First Use: The first coronary stent was implanted in a patient in Toulouse, France, in 1986. | 首次使用：第一個冠狀動脈支架於1986年在法國圖盧茲植入患者體內。
  • Initial Consequences: Post-stent placement effects include: | 支架放置後的初始後果包括：
    • De-endothelialization | 去內皮化
    • Crushing of the plaque | 斑塊壓碎
    • Stretching of the entire artery | 整個動脈拉伸

Stent Surgery Procedure | 支架手術程序

  • Procedure: Involves inserting a catheter into the body, avoiding open-chest surgery. | 程序：涉及將導管插入體內，避免開胸手術。
  • Patient Preference: Many patients prefer stenting due to its minimally invasive nature. No patients were excluded from stenting due to angiographic reasons or comorbidities, unlike traditional surgery. | 患者偏好：許多患者因其微創性而偏好支架植入術。與傳統手術不同，沒有患者因血管造影原因或合併症被排除在支架植入術之外。

Minimally Invasive Surgery | 微創手術

  • Definition: Uses small incisions instead of large ones, enabling complex procedures with: | 定義：使用小切口而非大切口，使複雜手術具備：
    • Less trauma to the body | 對身體的創傷較少
    • Reduced pain and scarring | 減少疼痛和瘢痕
    • Quicker recovery times compared to traditional surgery | 比傳統手術恢復時間更快

Need of Selection and Processing of Biomaterials | 生物材料選擇與加工的需求

Choice of Material of Bone Regeneration | 骨再生材料選擇

  • Interaction between biomaterials and biology | 生物材料與生物學的交互作用
    • From Stent | 從支架:
      • Restore the blood flow through de-endothelialization, crush of the plaque, and stretch of the entire artery | 通過去內皮化、斑塊壓碎和整個動脈拉伸恢復血流
    • From body | 從身體:
      • Platelet aggregation, inflammatory cell infiltration, release of growth factors, smooth muscle cell modulation and proliferation, ECM deposition and remodeling | 血小板聚集、炎症細胞浸潤、生長因子釋放、平滑肌細胞調節和增殖、細胞外基質沉積和重塑

Selection and Processing | 選擇與加工

  • Types of Biomaterials (mechanical properties, biocompatibility, degradation, non-thrombogenic, etc) | 生物材料類型（機械性能、生物相容性、降解性、非血栓形成等）

  • Processing involves a complex series of chemical, thermal, and physical processes that prepare a starting material, create a shape, retain that shape, refine the structure and shape. | 加工涉及一系列複雜的化學、熱和物理過程，準備起始材料、創建形狀、保持形狀、精煉結構和形狀。

  • Questions | 問題:
    For Hip Replacement vs Skull Replacement | 髖關節置換與顱骨置換:

    1. Titanium vs. Polycaprolactone? | 鈦與聚己內酯？
    2. Porous surface or smooth surface? | 多孔表面或光滑表面？
    3. Cell attractive or cell repellent? | 細胞吸引或細胞排斥？

Table: Hip Replacement vs Skull Replacement | 髖關節置換與顱骨置換比較

Aspect | 面向 Hip Replacement | 髖關節置換 Skull Replacement | 顱骨置換
Typical Patient | 典型患者 Aging population | 老年人群 Injury, surgery, tissue defect (broad age range) | 受傷、手術、組織缺陷（廣泛年齡範圍）
Primary Need | 主要需求 Mobility | 活動性 Structural restoration and integration | 結構恢復與整合
Material Used | 使用材料 Titanium | 鈦 Polycaprolactone / Titanium | 聚己內酯/鈦
Surface Type | 表面類型 Smooth surface | 光滑表面 Porous surface | 多孔表面
Fixation Strategy | 固定策略 Requires robust fixation | 需要堅固固定 Encourages bone tissue integration | 促進骨組織整合
Cell Interaction | 細胞交互 Cell repellent | 細胞排斥 Cell attractive | 細胞吸引

Answering Skill | 回答技巧

  • Characterization of biomaterials | 生物材料特性:
    • Polymers and hydrogel | 聚合物與水凝膠
    • Metals and inorganics | 金屬與無機物
    • Micro/nano-biomaterials | 微米/奈米生物材料
  • What does the body do to the biomaterials | 身體對生物材料的反應:
    • Host reaction to biomaterials and their evaluation | 宿主對生物材料的反應及其評估
    • Biological testing of biomaterials | 生物材料的生物測試
    • Degradation in biological environment | 生物環境中的降解
  • What does the biomaterials do to the body | 生物材料對身體的作用:
    • Biomaterials in drug delivery and imaging | 生物材料在藥物傳遞和成像中的應用
    • Biomaterials in implants | 生物材料在植入物中的應用
    • Biomaterials in tissue engineering | 生物材料在組織工程中的應用
    • Practical aspects of materials in biomedical engineering | 生物醫學工程中材料的實際面向

Lecture 2: Surface and Bulk Properties of Biomaterials | 第二講：生物材料的表面與體相性質

Lecture Introduction | 課程引言

  • Title: Surface and Bulk Properties of Biomaterials | 生物材料的表面與體相性質

Three Aspects in Biomaterials | 生物材料的三個面向

  • Aspects | 面向:
    1. Biological materials or body | 生物材料或身體
    2. Implant materials | 植入材料
    3. Interaction between the two in the body | 兩者在體內的交互作用

Surface and Bulk Properties Overview | 表面與體相性質概述

  • Surface Properties | 表面性質:
    • Surface contact angle | 表面接觸角
    • Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) | 掃描電子顯微鏡（SEM）
    • Electron Spectroscopy for Chemical Analysis (ESCA or XPS) | 電子能譜化學分析（ESCA或XPS）
    • Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry (TOF-SIMS) | 飛行時間二次離子質譜（TOF-SIMS）
    • Raman spectroscopy | 拉曼光譜
  • Bulk Properties | 體相性質:
    • Stress and strain | 應力與應變
    • Shear stress and shear strain | 剪應力與剪應變
    • Young’s modulus and shear modulus | 楊氏模量與剪切模量

Surface Properties Characteristics | 表面性質特徵

  • Key Points | 要點:
    1. Surfaces have unique reactivity. | 表面具有獨特的反應性。
    2. The surface is inevitably different from the bulk. | 表面與體相不可避免地不同。
    3. Surface molecules can exhibit considerable mobility. | 表面分子可展現顯著的流動性。

Surface Dynamics | 表面動態

  • Observation: The movement of atoms and molecules near the surface in response to the external environment is highly significant. | 觀察：表面附近的原子和分子對外部環境的響應具有重要意義。

Protein-Surface Interaction | 蛋白質-表面交互作用

  • Effect of Protein Size: Larger proteins with more amino acids can make more interactions with a surface. | 蛋白質大小的影響：具有更多氨基酸的較大蛋白質可與表面進行更多交互作用。

Surface Characteristics | 表面特性

  • Factors | 因素:
    • Roughness (A) | 粗糙度 (A)
    • Patterns (C) | 圖案 (C)
    • Wettability, surface mobility, chemical composition (B) | 潤濕性、表面流動性、化學組成 (B)
    • Electrical charge, crystallinity (E) | 電荷、結晶度 (E)
    • Heterogeneity (D & F) | 異質性 (D & F)

Cosmetic Contact Lenses | 彩色隱形眼鏡

  • Context: Pigments in cosmetic contact lenses may alter surface properties, impacting comfort compared to clear lenses. | 背景：彩色隱形眼鏡中的色素可能改變表面性質，影響與透明隱形眼鏡相比的舒適度。
  • Factors | 因素:
    • Location and depth of pigment particles from the lens surface | 色素顆粒與鏡片表面的位置和深度
    • Coefficient of friction | 摩擦係數
    • Surface roughness | 表面粗糙度
  • Source: Johnson & Johnson Vision Inc, Eye Contact Lens, 2018 Nov; 44(2):S256

Surface Analysis Considerations | 表面分析注意事項

  • Challenges | 挑戰:
    1. All methods can alter the surface. | 所有方法都可能改變表面。
    2. Potential for artifacts requires corroborative information from multiple methods to construct a complete surface profile. | 可能出現的偽影需要多種方法提供佐證信息以構建完整的表面輪廓。

Surface and Bulk Properties (Detailed) | 表面與體相性質（詳細）

  • Surface Properties | 表面性質:
    • Surface contact angle (hydrophobicity) | 表面接觸角（疏水性）
    • SEM (roughness and patterns) | 掃描電子顯微鏡（粗糙度與圖案）
    • ESCA or XPS (chemical composition) | 電子能譜化學分析或X射線光電子能譜（化學組成）
    • TOF-SIMS (chemical composition) | 飛行時間二次離子質譜（化學組成）
    • Raman spectroscopy (chemical composition) | 拉曼光譜（化學組成）
  • Bulk Properties | 體相性質:
    • Stress and strain (mechanical properties) | 應力與應變（機械性能）
    • Shear stress and shear strain (mechanical properties) | 剪應力與剪應變（機械性能）
    • Young’s modulus and shear modulus (mechanical properties) | 楊氏模量與剪切模量（機械性能）

Surface Contact Angle | 表面接觸角

  • Definition: Measures the balance between cohesive forces (liquid molecules attracted to each other) and adhesive forces (liquid molecules attracted to the surface). | 定義：測量液體分子相互吸引的內聚力與液體分子與表面吸引的黏附力之間的平衡。
  • Purpose: Directly measures surface wettability; indirectly probes surface energy, roughness, heterogeneity, contamination, and molecular mobility. | 目的：直接測量表面潤濕性；間接探測表面能量、粗糙度、異質性、污染和分子流動性。
  • Equation:
  • Where | 其中:
    • ((\gamma_{lv})): Liquid-vapor surface tension | 液-氣表面張力
    • ((\gamma_{sl})): Interfacial tension between solid and liquid | 固-液界面張力
    • ((\gamma_{sv})): Surface energy of the solid | 固體表面能量
    • ((\theta)): Contact angle | 接觸角

Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) | 掃描電子顯微鏡（SEM）

  • Function: Uses a high-energy electron beam (5-100 keV) rastered on a specimen under vacuum. | 功能：使用高能電子束（5-100 keV）在真空下對樣品進行掃描。
  • Mechanism: Low-energy secondary electrons (1-20 eV) are emitted from impact points, with intensity depending on atomic composition and geometry. | 機制：從撞擊點發射低能二次電子（1-20 eV），強度取決於原子組成和幾何形狀。
  • Note: Insulating materials require metallic coating; images reflect the coating surface, not the underlying material. | 注意：絕緣材料需要金屬塗層；圖像反映塗層表面，而非底層材料。

SEM Imaging | 掃描電子顯微鏡成像

  • Electrons Used: Secondary and backscattered electrons are used for SEM imaging. | 使用的電子：二次電子和背散射電子用於SEM成像。

Electron-Solid Interactions | 電子-固體交互作用

  • Regions | 區域:
    • Secondary Electron (SE): Produced wherever primary electrons go, but only those near the surface reach the SE detector for imaging. | 二次電子（SE）：只要初級電子到達就會產生，但只有靠近表面的二次電子到達SE檢測器進行成像。
    • Backscattered Electron (BSE): Produced with higher energy, travels farther than SE, provides better Z-contrast. | 背散射電子（BSE）：以較高能量產生，傳播距離比SE遠，提供更好的Z對比。
    • X-ray Region: Used for Energy-Dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy (EDX), travels farther than BSE, best for analytical purposes. | X射線區域：用於能量分散X射線光譜（EDX），傳播距離比BSE遠，最適合分析用途。
  • Applications | 應用:
    • SE: Best spatial resolution | 二次電子：最佳空間分辨率
    • BSE: Better Z-contrast | 背散射電子：更好的Z對比
    • EDX: Best for elemental analysis | 能量分散X射線光譜：最佳元素分析

X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS/ESCA) | X射線光電子能譜（XPS/ESCA）

  • Mechanism: An X-ray photon ejects an electron from an atom’s inner shell (e.g., K shell). The kinetic energy of the ejected electron allows calculation of binding energy, identifying elements. | 機制：X射線光子從原子內殼（例如K殼）中逐出電子。逐出電子的動能可用於計算結合能，識別元素。
  • Applications | 應用:
    • Identifies all elements except H and He (concentrations >0.1%). | 識別除H和He外的所有元素（濃度>0.1%）。
    • Semi-quantitative elemental surface composition (±10%). | 半定量元素表面組成（±10%）。
    • Provides molecular environment details (oxidation state, bonding atoms). | 提供分子環境細節（氧化態、鍵結原子）。
    • Detects aromatic/unsaturated structures via shake-up transitions. | 通過激發躍遷檢測芳香族/不飽和結構。
    • Identifies organic groups using derivatization reactions. | 使用衍生反應識別有機基團。
    • Non-destructive elemental depth profiles (~100 Å). | 非破壞性元素深度輪廓（~100 Å）。
    • Destructive depth profiles (thousands of Å) using argon etching (for inorganics). | 使用氬蝕刻進行破壞性深度輪廓（數千Å，用於無機物）。
    • Lateral surface composition variations (spatial resolution 8-150 µm). | 橫向表面組成變化（空間分辨率8-150 µm）。
    • Fingerprinting materials using valence band spectra and bonding orbitals. | 使用價帶光譜和鍵結軌道進行材料指紋識別。
    • Studies on hydrated (frozen) surfaces. | 研究水合（冷凍）表面。

Time-of-Flight Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry (TOF-SIMS) | 飛行時間二次離子質譜（TOF-SIMS）

  • Mechanism: Bombards surface with accelerated ions, ejecting secondary ions, radicals, excited states, and neutrals. Only secondary ions are measured. | 機制：用加速離子轟擊表面，逐出二次離子、自由基、激發態和中性粒子。僅測量二次離子。
  • Purpose: Analyzes elemental, isotopic, or molecular composition of the outermost 1-2 nm. | 目的：分析最外層1-2奈米的元素、同位素或分子組成。
  • Static SIMS: Uses low ion doses for analysis. | 靜態SIMS：使用低離子劑量進行分析。

When to Use EDX, ESCA, or SIMS | 何時使用EDX、ESCA或SIMS

  • EDX: For elemental composition of materials. | 用於材料的元素組成。
  • ESCA (XPS): For quantifying surface contamination, understanding electronic structure, or analyzing elemental/chemical states with good energy resolution. | 用於量化表面污染、理解電子結構或分析具有良好能量分辨率的元素/化學狀態。
  • SIMS: For high-sensitivity trace element detection, high-resolution surface imaging, or molecular composition analysis. | 用於高靈敏度痕量元素檢測、高分辨率表面成像或分子組成分析。

Raman Spectroscopy | 拉曼光譜

  • Definition: Measures the energy difference (Raman shift) between incident and scattered light. | 定義：測量入射光與散射光之間的能量差（拉曼位移）。
  • Spectrum: Vertical axis (intensity of scattered light), horizontal axis (wavenumber of Raman shift, cm⁻¹). | 光譜：縱軸（散射光強度），橫軸（拉曼位移波數，cm⁻¹）。
  • Example: Raman spectrum of tetrachloromethane (532 nm green laser): | 範例：四氯化碳的拉曼光譜（532奈米綠色激光）:
    • Stokes scattering: Lower wavenumber (longer wavelength), typically used for analysis. | 斯托克斯散射：較低波數（較長波長），通常用於分析。
    • Anti-Stokes scattering: Higher wavenumber (shorter wavelength), also usable. | 反斯托克斯散射：較高波數（較短波長），也可用。

Surface-Enhanced Raman Spectroscopy (SERS) | 表面增強拉曼光譜（SERS）

  • Technique: Uses nanostructured metal surfaces (gold or silver) to amplify Raman scattering signals via localized surface plasmons, enabling ultra-sensitive detection (down to single-molecule level). | 技術：使用奈米結構金屬表面（金或銀）通過局部表面電漿子放大拉曼散射信號，實現超靈敏檢測（低至單分子水平）。

Bulk Properties | 體相性質

  • Role: Dictate the ability to carry loads without undue deflection, premature failure, or degradation. | 角色：決定在不發生過度變形、過早失效或降解的情況下承載負荷的能力。
  • Properties | 性質:
    • Mechanical (stress, strain, moduli) | 機械（應力、應變、模量）
    • Thermal (response to heat) | 熱（對熱的響應）
    • Optical (response to light) | 光學（對光的響應）
  • Categories | 類別:
    • Intrinsic: Depend on composition (e.g., density, heat capacity, stiffness). | 內在：取決於組成（例如，密度、熱容量、剛度）。
    • Extrinsic: Depend on microstructure (e.g., yield strength, optical/magnetic properties). | 外在：取決於微觀結構（例如，屈服強度、光學/磁性質）。

Physical Properties | 物理性質

  • Examples | 範例:
    • Crystallinity | 結晶度
    • Thermal transition points (melting point ((T_m)), glass transition point ((T_g))) | 熱轉換點（熔點((T_m))、玻璃化轉變點((T_g))）
    • Chemical composition | 化學組成
  • Impact: Chemical composition affects bulk properties, surface chemistry, and other characteristics. | 影響：化學組成影響體相性質、表面化學和其他特性。

Mechanical Properties | 機械性質

  • Purpose: Estimate behavior under mechanical loads (tension, compression, torsion, bending, cyclic loading, impact). | 目的：估計在機械負載（拉伸、壓縮、扭轉、彎曲、循環負載、衝擊）下的行為。
  • Influence: Highly affected by physical and chemical characteristics. | 影響：高度受物理和化學特性的影響。

Tensile/Compressive Testing | 拉伸/壓縮測試

  • Method: Applies uniaxial loading (tensile, compressive, or shear) at controlled amplitude and rate. | 方法：以控制的幅度和速率施加單軸負載（拉伸、壓縮或剪切）。
  • Setup: One end of the specimen is attached to a movable platform. | 設置：樣品的一端附著在可移動平台上。

Compression Testing | 壓縮測試

  • Application: Common for biomaterials under compressive forces (e.g., orthopedic implants). | 應用：常用於承受壓縮力的生物材料（例如，骨科植入物）。
  • Specimen: Cylindrical, with length at least twice the diameter. | 樣品：圓柱形，長度至少為直徑的兩倍。
  • Calculation: Stress-strain calculated similarly to tensile tests, but values are negative. | 計算：應力-應變計算與拉伸測試類似，但值為負。

A Collection of Common Python Code Snippets

This blog post provides a curated list of commonly used Python code snippets, covering basic operations, data structures, file handling, and more. Each snippet includes a brief explanation and is ready to use or adapt for your projects. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced developer, these examples will serve as a handy reference.

1. Hello World

The classic “Hello, World!” program to get started with Python.

Explanation: The print() function outputs text to the console. This is often the first program written to test Python’s setup.

2. Working with Lists

Lists are one of Python’s most versatile data structures. Here’s how to create, append, and iterate over a list.

Explanation: Lists are ordered, mutable collections. The append() method adds an item to the end, and a for loop iterates over each element.

3. Dictionary Operations

Dictionaries store key-value pairs. This snippet shows how to create, access, and update a dictionary.

Explanation: Dictionaries are mutable and allow fast key-based access. Use items() to iterate over key-value pairs.

4. File Reading and Writing

Reading from and writing to files is a common task in Python.

Explanation: The with statement ensures the file is properly closed after use. Mode "w" is for writing, and "r" is for reading.

5. List Comprehension

List comprehensions provide a concise way to create lists based on existing iterables.

Explanation: List comprehensions combine loops and conditionals into a single line, improving readability and efficiency.

6. Function Definition

Functions help organize code into reusable blocks.

Explanation: The def keyword defines a function. The docstring ("""...""") describes its purpose, and return outputs the result.

7. Exception Handling

Handle errors gracefully with try-except blocks.

Explanation: The try block runs code that might raise an error. except blocks handle specific exceptions, preventing the program from crashing.

8. Working with Sets

Sets are useful for storing unique items and performing set operations.

Explanation: Sets automatically remove duplicates. Operators like | (union) and & (intersection) perform set operations.

9. String Manipulation

Python offers powerful string manipulation tools.

Explanation: Methods like strip(), split(), and join() make string processing straightforward.

10. Lambda Functions

Lambda functions are anonymous, single-expression functions for quick operations.

Explanation: Lambda functions are concise alternatives to regular functions, often used with functions like sorted() or map().

11. Working with Dates

The datetime module helps handle dates and times.

Explanation: The datetime module provides classes for date and time manipulation. timedelta is used for arithmetic with dates.

12. List Slicing

Slicing allows you to extract parts of a list (or other sequences).

Explanation: The syntax [start:end:step] extracts a portion of a list. Omitting start or end uses the list’s boundaries.

Conclusion

These Python snippets cover common tasks and demonstrate Python’s simplicity and power. Use them as a starting point for your projects or as a quick reference when coding. Python’s readability and flexibility make it ideal for both beginners and advanced developers. Happy coding!

entry.title: Introduction to Computer Programming:A Beginner's Guide
entry.content:
🧠 Overview | 概覽

This post summarizes key concepts from the CS1302: Introduction to Computer Programming lecture notes from City University of Hong Kong.
本文總結了香港城市大學《CS1302：電腦編程入門》課程筆記的重點內容。

It covers computer fundamentals, programming concepts, and an introduction to Python. Designed for beginners, it explains everything from hardware basics to why Python is a great starting language.
內容涵蓋電腦基本原理、編程概念，以及 Python 語言入門。這是一份為初學者設計的指南，從硬件基礎到為什麼 Python 是理想的入門語言都有詳細說明。

💻 What is a Computer? | 什麼是電腦？

A computer is more than an advanced calculator—it’s an electronic device that manipulates data and performs arithmetic operations.
電腦不僅僅是高級計算機，它是一種能夠處理資料並執行算術操作的電子設備。

Unlike ancient tools like the abacus, modern computers are programmable and versatile.
與古老的工具如算盤不同，現代電腦具有可編程性和多功能性。

🧩 Von Neumann Architecture | 馮·諾依曼架構

Most computers follow the Von Neumann architecture, which includes:
大多數電腦遵循「馮·諾依曼架構」，包括：

  • Input/Output Devices: Read/write data to/from memory on CPU command.
    輸入/輸出設備：根據 CPU 指令讀取或寫入記憶體資料。
    • Examples: Keyboard (input), Monitor (output), Touchscreen (both).
      例子：鍵盤（輸入）、顯示器（輸出）、觸控螢幕（輸入與輸出）。
  • Central Processing Unit (CPU): The “brain” of the computer.
    中央處理器（CPU）：電腦的「大腦」。
    • Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU): Performs binary math operations.
      算術邏輯單元（ALU）：執行二進位數學運算。
    • Control Unit (CU): Directs program execution.
      控制單元（CU）：指導程式執行流程。
  • Main Memory: Stores data and instructions.
    主記憶體：儲存資料與指令。

🧪 A CPU simulator in the original notes visualizes the fetch-decode-execute cycle.
🧪 原教材中的 CPU 模擬器展示了「提取-解碼-執行」循環。

🧠 What’s in a Computer? | 電腦的組成

A CPU consists of several main components:
一個 CPU 包含以下主要組件：

  • Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU): Performs arithmetic and logical operations.
    算術邏輯單元（ALU）：執行算術和邏輯運算。
  • Control Unit (CU): Directs processor operations.
    控制單元（CU）：指導處理器的操作。
  • Registers: Small, fast storage locations for temporary data and instructions.
    暫存器：用於暫時儲存資料和指令的小型高速儲存區。

🗂️ Memory Types | 記憶體類型

  • RAM (Random Access Memory): Volatile; holds data during execution.
    RAM（隨機存取記憶體）：揮發性；執行期間儲存資料。
    • Subtypes: SRAM (fast), DRAM (cheap).
      子類型：SRAM（快速）、DRAM（便宜）。
  • ROM (Read-Only Memory): Non-volatile; stores boot essentials.
    ROM（唯讀記憶體）：非揮發性；儲存開機所需資料。
    • Subtypes: PROM, EPROM, EEPROM.
      子類型：PROM、EPROM、EEPROM。

🧑‍💻 What is Programming? | 什麼是編程？

Programming is the process of writing instructions for computers to perform tasks.
編程是撰寫指令讓電腦執行特定任務的過程。

It’s like giving step-by-step directions in a language the computer understands.
就像用電腦能理解的語言提供逐步指示。

🔣 Programming Languages | 編程語言

Computers use binary (0s and 1s) for data and instructions.
電腦使用 二進位（0 和 1） 來表示資料與指令。

  • Example: Intel CPU addition → 00000011 00000100
    例子：Intel CPU 加法 → 00000011 00000100
  • Why Binary? Reliable for electronic circuits (on/off states).
    為什麼使用二進位？因為電子電路的開/關狀態非常可靠。

🕰️ Historical Note | 歷史小知識

  • ENIAC (1940s): First electronic computer.
    ENIAC（1940年代）：第一台電子電腦。
    • Used switches and inefficient decimal representation (10 bits = 1024 values).
      使用開關並以低效方式表示十進位數字（10 位元 = 1024 種可能）。

📏 Standards for Representation | 資料表示標準

  • ASCII: 8-bit codes for English characters (A = 01000001)
    ASCII：8 位元英文字元編碼（如 ‘A’ = 01000001）
  • Unicode: Supports global languages (e.g., Chinese, Japanese)
    Unicode：支援全球語言（如中文、日文）
  • Numbers:
    • 2’s complement for negatives
      負數使用二的補數
    • IEEE floating-point for decimals
      小數使用 IEEE 浮點格式

🧬 Generations of Programming Languages | 編程語言世代

GenerationDescriptionExample
1stMachine Language (binary)10101010
第一代機器語言（二進位）10101010
2ndAssembly Language (mnemonics)ADD, SUB
第二代組合語言（助記符）ADD, SUB
3rdHigh-Level LanguagesPython, Java, C++
第三代高階語言（人類可讀）Python, Java, C++

🧠 Assembly is still useful for microprocessors. A simulator demo compares assembly vs. high-level code.
🧠 組合語言仍適用於微處理器等高效率場景。教材中有模擬器展示組合語言與高階語言的比較。

🐍 Introduction to Python | Python 語言簡介

Python is chosen for its:
選擇 Python 的原因：

  • Expressiveness: Write less, do more.
    表達力強：少量程式碼即可完成任務。
  • Popularity: Rich libraries (math, AI, graphics).
    廣泛使用：擁有大量函式庫（數學、AI、圖形等）。
  • Free & Open-Source: No restrictions.
    免費且開源：無使用限制。
  • Portability: Runs on multiple platforms.
    可移植性高：跨平台執行無需修改。
